intro: Oscularia cedarbergensis, commonly known as the Cedarberg carpetweed, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its small, star-shaped flowers are often pink or red, adding ornamental value. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
